annotation.text: When Ser-34 was mutated to Asp, there was significantly reduced RhoGDIalpha binding to RhoA (by around 75%) but not Rac1 or Cdc42.
When Ser-34 was mutated to Asp, there was significantly reduced RhoGDIalpha binding to RhoA (by around 75%) but not Rac1 or Cdc42.
In a second assay, mutations of Ser-34 and Ser-62 to either Asp or Ala were compared. Single mutations of Ser-62 to either Asp or Ala had no effect on the binding of either RhoA or Rac1 (Fig. 6B).
In a second assay, mutations of Ser-34 and Ser-62 to either Asp or Ala were compared. Single mutations of Ser-62 to either Asp or Ala had no effect on the binding of either RhoA or Rac1 (Fig. 6B).
Phosphomimetic RhoGDIalpha at residue 34 leads to decreased retention of RhoA but no change in binding of Rac1 or Cdc42.
Phosphomimetic RhoGDIalpha at residue 34 leads to decreased retention of RhoA but no change in binding of Rac1 or Cdc42.
Quantitation shows that phosphomimetic RhoGDIalpha has decreased ability to bind RhoA, although binding to Rac1 and Cdc42 is unaffected.
Quantitation shows that phosphomimetic RhoGDIalpha has decreased ability to bind RhoA, although binding to Rac1 and Cdc42 is unaffected.
Quantitation shows that phosphomimetic RhoGDIalpha has decreased ability to bind RhoA, although binding to Rac1 and Cdc42 is unaffected.
D, exchange of GDP for GTP in RhoA is high in free GTPase but low when complexed to RhoGDIalpha.
D, exchange of GDP for GTP in RhoA is high in free GTPase but low when complexed to RhoGDIalpha.
As shown in Fig. 6D, free RhoA rapidly exchanged its bound nucleotide (GDP) with GTP, and the reaction was saturated after 15 min, with an efficiency of ~15%.
As shown in Fig. 6D, free RhoA rapidly exchanged its bound nucleotide (GDP) with GTP, and the reaction was saturated after 15 min, with an efficiency of ~15%.
